page.description: Sort the elements of an array.

argument.name: array_name
argument.description: A character string containing the name of the array.

argument.name: sort_options
argument.description: Optional. Default = Sort ascending. 1 = Sort descending.

page.discussion: *[xb:SORT_ARRAY()]* sorts the specified character, numeric, or date array. The Array_Name parameter is a character string containing the name of the array. The default sort order is ascending order. Set the optional Sort Options parameter to 1 to sort in descending order. Note : *[xb:SORT_ARRAY()]* is documented for backward compatibility only. It has been replaced by the *[xb:<ARRAY>.SORT()]* method.

section.title: Example
section.description: Fills the color array and then sorts the values in both ascending and descending order.
section.example: dim color[3] as C Color[1] = "Red" Color[2] = "Blue" Color[3] = "Green" sort_array("color") for i = 1 to 3 trace.writeln(color[i] ) next i sort_array("color", 1) for i = 1 TO 3 trace.writeln(color[i] ) next i

section.description: Same as above, but uses the <ARRAY>.SORT()method.
section.example: dim color3 as C Color[1] = "Red" Color[2] = "Blue" Color[3] = "Green" Color.sort() for i = 1 TO 3 trace.writeln(color[i] ) next i Color.sort(.f.) 'descending sort for i = 1 TO 3 trace.writeln(color[i] ) next i
